    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Board
    Represents the Go board and handles stone placement, capturing, and rule enforcement.
    Board.Direction
    Represents the four orthogonal directions for neighboring fields.
    CaptureInKoException
     
    Client
    A command-line interface (CLI) client for the Go game.
    Client.ServerListener
    A helper class responsible for listening to incoming server messages.
    Field
    Represents a single intersection (field) on the Go board.
    FieldNotAvailableException
     
    FieldOcupiedException
     
    GameContext
    Represents the current context of a Go game.
    GameFinished
     
    GameInputAdapter<InputType>
    Defines the contract for handling incoming game commands.
    GameManager
    Singleton class responsible for managing the overall game flow.
    GameNotInitialized
     
    GameNotRunningException
     
    GameOutputAdapter<OutputType>
    Defines the contract for sending game updates to clients.
    GamePaused
     
    GameRunning
     
    GameState
     
    GameStateBehaviour
     
    GUIClient
    The graphical client application for the Go game, built with JavaFX.
    GUIInputGameAdapter
    An implementation of GameInputAdapter tailored for GUI clients.
    GUIOutputGameAdapter
    An implementation of GameOutputAdapter designed for GUI clients.
    IllegalStoneOfBothColorsException
     
    InputGameAdapter
    An implementation of GameInputAdapter tailored for Console/Terminal clients.
    Move
    Represents a single move in the game.
    OtherPlayersTurnException
     
    OutputException
     
    OutputGameAdapter
    An implementation of GameOutputAdapter designed for Console-based clients.
    PlayerColor
    Represents the color of a player in the game.
    Server
    The main entry point for the Game Server.
    Stone
    Represents a single stone on the Go board.
    StoneChain
    Represents a chain of connected stones of the same color on the board.
    SuicideException
     
    WrongMoveFormat
    Indicates that the input string provided for a game move does not adhere to the required syntax or format.
